chargeHist.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keith L Hughes

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keith L Hughes not in court, in custody.  Attorney James Gregory McCann in court for Keith L Hughes.  Attorney Kelly O'Neill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  Defense withdrew bail motion at this time.  Court set final pretrial and speedy jury trial dates upon request from the defense.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by 11-03-2022. The final pretrial will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Keith L Hughes appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney James Gregory McCann in court in person for Keith L Hughes.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kelly O'Neill in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense Counsel requests Speedy Trial Demand. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and Filed:  Order appointing counsel at county expense.

Defendant Keith L Hughes appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kimberly Dorice Schoepp in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status of counsel.  Due to the State Public Defender failing to timely appoint counsel, the Court appointed counsel at Milwaukee County expense.  Court appoints Attorney James McCann who shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court orders the defendant to repay the County $60 total upon completion of the case.  Case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Keith L Hughes not in court, defendant in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witnesses are present. SPD failed to appoint counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with KDJ DOB: 7/19/06; JKH DOB: 4/19/08; Alexis Sandlin-El; NRG DOB: 6/13/06
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court order co defendants kept separate while in custody.

Defendant Keith L Hughes in court with Attorney Theodore Kafkas. Defendant Keith L Hughes in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keith L Hughes appeared by video means with Attorney.  Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
